description: This course provides a global perspective on economic development and introduces students to
analytic tools that empower them to investigate causes of, and potential solutions to,
underdevelopment. Students further develop and apply their learning in the context of a specific
country of their choosing, about which they research and write throughout the semester. Counts
toward Quantitative Research requirement for the Quantitative Economics major.  Prerequisites:
ECON 261 and ECON 262 and one of ECON 260 OR (STAT 272 and ECON 384) OR (STAT 272 and ECON 385).
